name: Natrum arsenicum

Head: Floating sensation on turning head quickly; aching in frontal region and root of nose, over orbits
Headache; worse, pressure and tobacco smoke
Respiratory: OPPRESSION OF CHEST AND ABOUT HEART, and also larynx
Lungs feel as though smoke had been inhaled
Racking cough, with profuse greenish expectoration
Eyes: Eyes feel weak, stiffness of balls and tendency of lids to close
Nose: Post-nasal dropping of thick, bland, yellowish mucus
Dry crusts, on removal, leave mucous membrane raw
Throat: Dark, PURPLISH, SWOLLEN, EDEMATOUS; red and glassy
Extremities: Aching in arms; worse in shoulder

details: A remedy for nasal catarrh, with headache, pain at root of nose, dry and painful eyes. Psoriasis. (ARS.; CHRYSOPH-AC.; THYROID.) Bronchitis of children over seven years. Facilitates the termination of the cold and conserves strength and appetite. (Cartier.)Sleeping sickness; commencing optic atrophy.
